result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek T. Zalewski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs including the Domestic Abuse and DNA surcharges.
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Obtain and maintain full time employment.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

Participate in the Domestic Abuse Alternatives Program. 
Participate in other counseling as recommended by the agent and reasonably required.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derek T. Zalewski

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Derek T. Zalewski in court with attorney Anne Renc. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:20 AM Court calls case


Defendant will plead to Count 2.
Count 1 would be dismissed and read in.

State makes the recommendations.
Atty Renc concurs.

Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 2.

Court accepts the plea.
Court reviews the file.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Court finds that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Dismissed and Read In
Count 2: Disorderly Conduct

BY THE COURT:
Count 2:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 18 Months
Conditions:
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business 
Obtain and maintain full time employment
Participate in the Domestic Abuse Alternatives Program
Participate in other counseling as recommended by the agent reasonably required
Not possess any firearms
Pay court costs
Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge
Pay DNA Surcharge
$150 previously posted for bond is to be applied to obligation
60 days to pay

Appeal rights are addressed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 16, 2014 at 11:15 am.
PTC 7/28/ Notice - No Such Number Unable to Forward
Pre-trial conference on July 28, 2014 at 10:00 am.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea entered.

Bond Continued

Defendant Derek T. Zalewski in court with attorney Anne Renc. David R Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Deputy J. Mulrooney is called and sworn. 
Direct exam by Atty Knaapen. 

BY THE COURT:  Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 28, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 23, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Derek T. Zalewski in court with attorney Anne J Renc. Intern Krause w/ADA David R Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Time limits waived for prelim.
Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
